title: Spaghetti alla Carbonara
description: Spaghetti alla Carbonara is a rich, creamy Roman pasta made with eggs, cheese, pork, and black pepper—no cream involved. The sauce forms when hot pasta emulsifies eggs and cheese.
fun_fact: Carbonara originated in Rome in the mid-20th century. One theory links it to charcoal workers (“carbonai”), while another credits American soldiers who introduced bacon and eggs during WWII.
instructions: Boil pasta in well-salted water until al dente.
Dice guanciale and cook over medium heat until crisp; remove from heat.
Whisk eggs, yolk, cheese, and black pepper in a bowl.
Reserve ½ cup pasta water, then drain pasta.
Add pasta to guanciale, then remove from heat.
Stir in egg mixture quickly, adding pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and pepper.
